Reviews.Content: If you can find a better deal (or even pay slightly more), stay somewhere else. I spent four months studying in Italy and I stayed in hotels and hostels all around the country...this hotel had them all beat--and not in a good way! The bathroom was awful, the rooms gross. As a young American student I was given about as much respect by the staff as a Nazi.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great. We read the review on this sight and were worried about our booking. The review couldn't have been more wrong. The room was clean and the shower only flooded if you waved your arms about (just try to keep them down a little). The room was noisey with the double glazed windows open but with them closed there was no problem.The queen beds were clean and comfortable. Sadly the bath towels are bath sheets but they were clean each dayand there were plenty. The hotel is an easy walk from the Collaseum and the centre of Rome. We had a balcony that looked out on the porta itself. The staff were helpful and the food was great if somewhat erratic in the way it was served. I thought the hotel was great and would happily stay there again. Whoever wrote the negative review must usually only stay in five star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “lOVED MAGGI”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned on Sunday having spent 3 nights at the Hotel. Staff were very helpfull and very friendly. My daughter Jane treated me to this short break for my Christmas and it was a very worthwhile gift. I would certainly recommend the Hotel and have already done so to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Uhhhh! Whatever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during Thanksgiving 2004. I booked the package through Gate1 Travel. This hotel is on the far side of town, not really close to anything. However, public transportation is close by. The subway is a few blocks over and the street cars stop right across the street. This hotel has long winding hallways and misplaced room numbers. I stayed in room 3N and my parents stayed in 3P. I believe these are some of the newer rooms in a newer wing of the hotel. We looked at 4 rooms before we settled on these. The other ones were smelly and old. The bathrooms were OK. They had bedets in them if that's your thing. The showers were small and so were the beds. I believe the beds were actually smaller than US twin size beds. This hotel is mainly situated in a residential area. I found it hard to find decent places to eat and just have a drink. Most shops and restaurants close around 9 or 10pm so after that, you're out of luck. However, on the last night I found an all night hamburger/ hot dog stand on the other side of the train tracks. It served the purpose in a crunch. Overall, this hotel was OK. Besides, you're not staying in the room all day anyway. I felt safe around hotel, safer than downtown or on the Metro. You live and you learn. Make the best of it. The daily breakfast buffet is a European one. Don't come looking for hot food or fruit -only sliced meats and cheeses. ( I hate this!!!!) Oh! And forget any TV or Cable- it's all in Italian. Ciao!!! Enjoy Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Portamaggiore Hotel is a great find”
Reviews.Author: micheller
Reviews.Content: I had read a few disfavorable reviews about the PORTAMAGGIORE HOTEL and was dubious of the package I had purchased. However, my stay was very pleasant and the room was very nice and the location very close to the Metro Line A train which left us minutes from the hot spots. One thing if you are looking to go out the night life in the area is scarce and I would recommend the area surrounding Piazza di Spagna (Spanish Steps). THe staff was not very helpful. Except for one individual who worked in the late night, he was amazing at providing infomation. The day staff was somewhat clueless. Various reviews mentioned sirens in the middle of the night, we heard nothing but pure silence. The cappuccino next door is amazing. The hotel bkfst. can be skipped. I hope you love ROME as much as I did.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Portamaggiore
HotelInfo.Address: Piazza Portamaggiore 25, 00185 Rome, Italy
